page.title: 01THE COLY VALLEY
page.content: The Coly valley is one of the main tributary vallies of the river Axe in east Devon. The river Coly rises at the top of the dip slope of the Greensands that cover much of East Devon east of the Otter valley. The river and it's tributaries run west to east through a landscape of broad flat valley bottoms made up of Keuper marls. The valley sides are flanked by encarpments of Greensands,which also form the highlands of the region. The Greensands wich form the dissected plateau is exposed and of limited agricultural use.Much of it is devoted to rough grazing heath or conifer plantation.
